context: The Estonian word 'uni' can refer to both sleep (the state of being asleep) and dreams. It is a singular noun in its base form. In different contexts, it might be used to describe the quality of someone's sleep ('hea uni' - good sleep), future rest periods ('tulevane uni' - upcoming sleep/dream), or interesting dream experiences ('põnev uni' - exciting dream). The word can appear in singular and plural forms depending on context.
